name: Bradman, Jesse M.
title: President, KickPort International LLC; Licensed Real Estate Broker
notes: Jesse Bradman is based in Petaluma, California, where he serves as President of KickPort International LLC, a drum and percussion accessories company he co-founded in 2009 with distribution in over 50 countries. He holds a BA from UC Berkeley and a law degree from Golden Gate University, and has been a principal investor in hundreds of residential and commercial real estate deals.

name: Breck, Ted B.
title: Managing Director, J. Wood Capital Advisors LLC
notes: Ted Breck joined J. Wood Capital Advisors in 2019 after two decades in healthcare investment banking at Lehman Brothers (New York and San Francisco) and nine years co-founding TPG's structured life sciences investments. He holds a BA in Social Science from UC Berkeley.
ngos: Advisory Council, J. David Gladstone Institutes (UCSF-affiliated biomedical research nonprofit)

name: Bressic, Paul Boyce
title: President, Boulevard Properties, Inc.
notes: Paul Boyce Bressic is a California commercial real estate executive based in Belvedere Tiburon. He holds a BS in Economics from UC Berkeley and has previously worked as a project manager at Spieker Properties and an office leasing broker at Cushman & Wakefield.

name: Callender, William C.
title: Unknown
notes: William C. Callender is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not identified through public records searches.

name: Covarrubias, Michael A.
title: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, TMG Partners
notes: Michael A. Covarrubias is Chairman and CEO of TMG Partners, a San Francisco-based privately-held full-service real estate development firm. He joined TMG in 1988 and has directed the company since 1995, overseeing development of more than 30 million square feet of Bay Area projects. He co-chaired the Committee to House the Bay Area (CASA) and serves on the Board of Directors of The Real Estate Roundtable.
ngos: Co-Chair, Committee to House the Bay Area (CASA); Board of Directors, The Real Estate Roundtable

name: D'Ambrosio, Franc John
title: Opera Singer, Stage and Screen Performer; Founder, Lorenzo Malfatti Accademia Vocale di Lucca
notes: Franc D'Ambrosio is a New York-born singer and actor best known as 'The Iron Man of the Mask' for performing the lead in The Phantom of the Opera over 2,100 times, the world record. He also appeared as Anthony Corleone in The Godfather Part III (1990) and co-hosts the touring show 'The Four Phantoms in Concert.'

name: Danielsen, Paul
title: Unknown
notes: Paul Danielsen is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp based in San Francisco. Definitive biographical and employer information was not identified through public records searches.

name: Dewey, Richard R. Jr.
title: President and CEO, Dewey Land Company, Inc.
notes: Richard R. Dewey Jr. founded Dewey Land Company in San Mateo, California in 1990 and has over 40 years of commercial real estate development experience, having developed more than 6 million square feet of commercial, life science lab, and multi-family projects. He holds a BA in Economics and BS in Business Administration from the University of Southern California.

name: Egan, Mark
title: Partner, StrataFusion Group
notes: Mark Egan is a technology executive with over 25 years of IT leadership experience. He previously served as CIO at VMware and Symantec, and developed and taught a graduate course at UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business on building business value through IT innovation.

name: Fletcher, James Jay
title: Unknown
notes: James Jay Fletcher is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not identified through public records searches.

name: Fritz, Lynn C.
employer: Fritz Institute (founder); Fritz Companies / UPS Supply Chain (former)
title: Founder and Director General, Fritz Institute; former Chairman and CEO, Fritz Companies
notes: Lynn C. Fritz is the founder and former Chairman/CEO of Fritz Companies, which he built into a Fortune 1000 international logistics firm with 11,000 employees before selling it to UPS in 2001. He subsequently founded the Fritz Institute, a nonprofit that develops best practices for humanitarian logistics and disaster relief, and LynnCo Supply Chain Solutions. He was inducted into the Logistics Hall of Fame in 2021.
ngos: Founder and Director General, Fritz Institute (humanitarian logistics nonprofit); Board of Trustees, Exploratorium (San Francisco)

name: Ganassi, Floyd R. (Chip) Jr.
title: Owner and CEO, Chip Ganassi Racing
notes: Floyd 'Chip' Ganassi Jr. is the owner and CEO of Chip Ganassi Racing, one of motorsport's most successful teams with over 270 wins, 24 championships, and 6 Indianapolis 500 victories. Based in Pittsburgh, PA, he is a former racing driver whose career was cut short by a 1984 crash. He holds a finance degree from Duquesne University and is a member of the Motorsports Hall of Fame of America.
political_donations: Donated $10,000 to Republican Federal Committee of Pennsylvania (c. 2010); $1,200 in political contributions in 2020 cycle

name: Gensler, David
employer: Gensler (former Co-CEO); Stanford Distinguished Careers Institute (Fellow)
title: Former Co-CEO, Gensler; Fellow, Stanford Distinguished Careers Institute
notes: David Gensler served as Co-CEO of Gensler, the world's largest architecture firm, for approximately 10 years after previously holding roles as COO and Regional Managing Principal. Son of founder Art Gensler. He holds a BA from Dartmouth College and an MBA from Stanford University, and has been involved in NextSpace and RocketSpace co-working companies as a board director/advisor.
ngos: Cornell College of Architecture, Art and Planning (civic involvement); Cornell School of Human Ecology (civic involvement); Junior Achievement of Southern California

name: Gruber, Frederick Wm.
title: Unknown
notes: Frederick Wm. Gruber is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp. Public records indicate he attended NYU Stern School of Business and University of Southern California Marshall School of Business, with addresses in the San Francisco Bay Area and Pebble Beach, California.

name: Hale, Robert V.
title: Unknown
notes: Robert V. Hale is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Hansel, Henry
title: President, Hansel Auto Group
notes: Henry Hansel is the President of the Hansel Auto Group, the largest group of car dealers in Sonoma County, California, which his father Walter founded in 1961. The group operates multiple dealerships in Santa Rosa and Petaluma. Henry oversees operations alongside his son Justin Hansel.

name: Heidt, John M.
title: Unknown
notes: John M. Heidt is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Kelly, Michael W.
title: Unknown
notes: Michael W. Kelly is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: LaHorgue, Michael
title: President and Senior Managing Partner, Carmel Partners
notes: Michael LaHorgue joined Carmel Partners as President in 2014 with over 30 years of institutional real estate investment experience. He previously spent nine years at Shorenstein Properties as President of Shorenstein Realty Services and founded Seaview Ventures LLC in 2001. He holds a BA in Political Science from UC Berkeley.

name: LeBuhn, Donald A.
title: Executive Managing Director, Cushman & Wakefield
notes: Donald A. LeBuhn is a commercial real estate professional who has been in the industry since 1986. He relocated to the San Francisco Bay Area after completing a Master's degree in real estate development and investments at NYU. He focuses on retail investment sales including grocery-anchored, NNN, and urban properties throughout Northern California.

name: Mathai, Raj
title: Primary News Anchor, NBC Bay Area (KNTV)
notes: Raj Mathai is a twelve-time Emmy Award-winning weeknight news anchor at NBC Bay Area, where he has worked since 1998. He anchors the 5:30, 6, 7, and 11 p.m. broadcasts and was the first Indian sportscaster for a network affiliate in the U.S. (1995). He graduated from San Diego State University with a degree in journalism and political science.
ngos: Board of Governors, San Francisco Symphony; Board of Directors, Asian Pacific Fund

name: McAuliffe, Richard Charles M.D.
title: Gastroenterologist, Greenbrae, California
notes: Dr. Richard C. McAuliffe is a gastroenterologist based in Greenbrae, California, affiliated with MarinHealth Medical Center. He received his medical degree from McGill University Faculty of Medicine and has been in practice for more than 20 years.

name: Pace, Peter USMC (Ret)
employer: SM&A Strategic Advisors (former); Multiple corporate boards
title: General, USMC (Ret.); 16th Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (2005-2007)
notes: General Peter Pace is the first and only Marine to have served as both Vice Chairman and Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. He retired in 2007 after 40+ years of service and was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2008. He has served on the boards of AAR Corp., Pike Electric, Qualys, and Textura Corporation, and teaches at Indiana University, Fordham University, and Georgetown University.
ngos: Board, Marine Corps Law Enforcement Foundation; Advisory Board, Wall Street Warfighters Foundation; Advisory Board, Our Military Kids; U.S. Naval Institute Foundation Board of Trustees

name: Pence, J. Blair II
title: Unknown
notes: J. Blair Pence II is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Phelan, Michael Aloysius
title: Unknown
notes: Michael Aloysius Phelan is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Pinkus, Gary Stuart
employer: PACT Capital Partners (current); McKinsey & Company (former Chairman, North America)
title: Former Chairman of McKinsey & Company North America (2018-2025); Independent Director, Bloom Energy and Walker & Dunlop
notes: Gary Pinkus spent nearly 40 years at McKinsey & Company, joining in 1987 and rising to Chairman of North America in 2018. He co-founded McKinsey's global Private Equity & Principal Investors practice and chaired the Senior Partners Committee since 2019. He holds a BA from Stanford and MBA from Harvard Business School and resides in Woodside, California.
ngos: Board of Trustees, Wake Forest University; Board, US Ski and Snowboard; Former board: San Francisco Opera, California Academy of Sciences, ReSurge International, California Business Roundtable, Silicon Valley Leadership Group

name: Rawson, David R.
title: Partner, Zeisler Zeisler Rawson & Johnson (Business Manager, Entertainment Industry)
notes: David R. Rawson is a business manager in the entertainment industry based in Marin County, California, who has worked in the field since 1992 and joined ZZRJ in 1999. He holds an MBA from Golden Gate University (1992) and a BA in Business from the University of Cincinnati (1982). He and his wife have lived in Marin County for over 35 years.

name: Reynolds, Jon Q. (Jake)
title: Co-Founder and Chairman Emeritus, Reynolds & Brown (commercial real estate)
notes: Jon Q. Reynolds co-founded Reynolds & Brown in 1967 and has been a real estate investment developer for over 44 years in the Oakland, California area. He served as Trustee of the Urban Land Institute for 12 years and was appointed by the Governor to the California Military Base Reuse Task Force. He is a UC Berkeley graduate.
ngos: Co-founder and Chairman, Oakland Housing Foundation; Commissioner, Oakland/Alameda County Coliseum Board; Former Board, East Bay Municipal Utility District (Chairman, 5 years); Policy Advisory Board, UC Berkeley Fisher Center for Real Estate

name: Robertson, Mark Owen
title: Unknown
notes: Mark Owen Robertson is a Bohemian Club member in the Monastery camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Rogers, Mike
employer: CNN (National Security Commentator); Former U.S. Representative (Michigan, 2001-2015)
title: National Security Commentator and Host, CNN; Former Chairman, House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence
notes: Michael J. Rogers represented Michigan's 8th congressional district from 2001 to 2015 as a Republican and chaired the House Intelligence Committee from 2011-2015. A former FBI special agent specializing in organized crime, he became a CNN national security commentator and host of 'Declassified' after leaving Congress. He was the 2024 Republican Senate nominee in Michigan.

name: Rowell, Robert W.
employer: The Wagstaffe Group (former); Golden State Warriors (former President)
title: Former President, Golden State Warriors NBA franchise (2003-2011)
notes: Robert Rowell worked for the Golden State Warriors for 16 years (1995-2011), rising from assistant controller to Team President. He oversaw the team's rebranding and digital expansion and was COO from 2001 before becoming President in 2003. After leaving the Warriors he became a partner at The Wagstaffe Group, a legal publishing company. He holds a degree from Cal Poly San Luis Obispo.

name: Walton, William Hampton III
title: Co-Founder and Managing Member, Rockpoint Group, LLC
notes: William H. Walton III co-founded Rockpoint Group in 1994 (formerly Westbrook Real Estate Partners) after serving as Managing Director in Morgan Stanley's real estate group (1979-1994). He holds an AB from Princeton University and MBA from Harvard Business School. He is an Independent Director at Boston Properties, Inc. and FRP Holdings, Inc.
ngos: Trustee, American Enterprise Institute; Board Member, Thurgood Marshall College Fund; Former: President, National Symphony; Treasurer, Wolf Trap; Trustee, National Gallery of Art; Member, Federal City Council; Director, U.S. Chamber of Commerce

name: Abbott, Frank W. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Frank W. Abbott Jr. is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp, residing in Burlingame, California. Specific employer and biographical details were not identified through public records searches.

name: Ameral, Andrew
title: Founder and Director, Golden Gate Atelier; Artist
notes: Andrew Ameral is a San Francisco-born figurative oil painter and art educator. He graduated with honors from the California College of Arts and Crafts and studied painting at the Florence Academy of Art. In 2010 he founded the Golden Gate Atelier in Oakland, California, offering instruction in traditional academic drawing and painting to students worldwide.

name: Bentley, William
title: Unknown
notes: William Floyd Bentley (February 20, 1945 - June 6, 2025) was a longtime Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp. He passed away in 2025 after a brief battle with cancer. Specific employer and biographical details were limited in available public records.

name: Boswell, James W.
title: Chairman and CEO, J.G. Boswell Company
notes: James W. Boswell is Chairman and CEO of J.G. Boswell Company, headquartered in Pasadena, California, the largest privately owned farm in the world. Founded in 1925, the company operates agricultural and real estate businesses in California's San Joaquin Valley and New South Wales, Australia, with over 2,000 employees. He is the son of J.G. Boswell II and a 1977 Cal Poly SLO graduate.
ngos: President, James G. Boswell Foundation; Member, Aspen Institute

name: Churich, Kenneth J.
title: Senior Vice President, CBRE
notes: Kenneth J. Churich is a San Francisco commercial real estate professional with over 33 years of experience in the San Francisco Financial District and Northern California. He began his career at Cushman & Wakefield in 1985, then spent over five years at Equity Office Properties, before joining The CAC Group (acquired by CBRE). He graduated from UC Berkeley in Political Economy.

name: Clapp, John D.
title: Unknown
notes: John D. Clapp is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Costello, Joseph V. III
employer: Metrics Design Automation; Kwikbit; Arrikto (Chairman of all three)
title: Former President and CEO, Cadence Design Systems (1988-1997); Current Chairman of multiple tech companies
notes: Joseph V. Costello III (known as Joe Costello) served as CEO of Cadence Design Systems from 1988 to 1997, growing it from a $10M company to over $1B in annual revenue, the world's leading EDA software firm. Named top CEO of all public companies in North America by Chief Executive Magazine in 1997 and received the Phil Kaufman Award in 2004. He holds a BS in Physics from Harvey Mudd College and graduate degrees from Yale and UC Berkeley.

name: DeVoto, Terence Alan
title: President, Northern California Broadcasters Association
notes: Terence Alan DeVoto is a Kentfield, California resident and President of the Northern California Broadcasters Association. Born August 2, 1946, he attended the University of San Francisco (Special Education credential). He has been involved with Ascend Educational Services and reportedly was affiliated with Jacuzzi Family Winery.

name: Diffenderfer, G. Edward
title: Illustrator and Painter; Member, Society of Illustrators (San Francisco)
notes: G. Edward Diffenderfer (born 1928, Stockton, CA) was a California illustrator and painter associated with the Bohemian Club. He attended the California College of Arts and Crafts and worked as an instructor of illustration and freelance illustrator. His work is held in the Pentagon, Smithsonian Institution, Library of Congress, and Air Force Academy. Died 2023.

name: Drewes, John Frederick
title: Chief Executive Officer, Devine Intermodal (Devine & Son Trucking Co.)
notes: John Frederick Drewes is CEO of Devine Intermodal in West Sacramento, California, one of the largest intermodal trucking fleets in California. He previously served as Chair of the California Trucking Association. Devine Intermodal traces its roots to 1920s Sacramento and operates terminals in Reno, Stockton, Fresno, and Oakland.

name: Eckard, George R.
title: Executive Director, Capital Markets, Cushman & Wakefield
notes: George R. Eckard is an Executive Director in Capital Markets at Cushman & Wakefield, based in La Quinta, California. He holds a BA from UC Berkeley and has extensive experience in commercial real estate including property management, leasing, and valuations. He previously served as Senior Vice President at Colliers.

name: Federal, William Aubrey Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: William Aubrey Federal Jr. is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp residing in Tiburon, California. His father, William Aubrey Federal, was founder and owner of Federal Glass & Hardware. Specific employer details for William Aubrey Federal Jr. were not identified through public records searches.

name: Field, James L.
title: Unknown
notes: James L. Field is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Field, Robert W. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Robert W. Field Jr. is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Finger, John William
title: Co-Founder and President, Hog Island Oyster Company
notes: John Finger co-founded Hog Island Oyster Co. in 1983 with a $500 loan, starting with a 5-acre lease on Tomales Bay in Marin County. He holds a BS in Marine Biology from Southampton College. The company has grown to 160 acres in Tomales Bay and 90 acres in Humboldt Bay, producing over 5 million oysters annually and operating multiple restaurant locations.

name: Fried, Richard B. 'Rocky'
title: Managing Member, Real Estate Group, Farallon Capital Management
notes: Richard B. 'Rocky' Fried joined Farallon Capital Management in 1995 and heads the firm's real estate investment group. He previously worked at Security Capital Industrial Trust (now Prologis) and JMB Institutional Realty Corporation. He graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania with degrees in Economics and History. He serves on the boards of Hudson Pacific Properties and Playa Hotels & Resorts.

name: Gregory, Quintard
title: Former Division Manager, Zellerbach Paper Co.
notes: Quintard 'Tod' Gregory served as Division Manager of Zellerbach Paper Co. (Crown Zellerbach), a major California paper company. He also served on the Board of Directors of the Sacramento Metropolitan Chamber of Commerce. Historical records of him are documented in the Calisphere digital archive.
ngos: Board of Directors, Sacramento Metropolitan Chamber of Commerce

name: Higgins, Tyler William
title: Co-Founder and Managing Partner, Orchard Partners, LLC
notes: Tyler Higgins co-founded Orchard Partners in 2007, a Bay Area commercial real estate investment firm that has sponsored over $2 billion in transactions. A fifth-generation Bay Area native, he previously served as Managing Director at AMB Property Corporation (now Prologis) for 16 years, participating in its 1997 IPO. He holds a BA in Economics from UC Berkeley.
ngos: ULI Governor/Builder; Former Scoutmaster, Boy Scout Troop 219, Lafayette, CA; Former Board, Boy Scout Mt. Diablo Silverado Council; Policy Advisory Board, UC Berkeley Fisher Center for Real Estate

name: Hunt, Robert L.
title: Unknown
notes: Robert L. Hunt is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Janssens, Luc G.
employer: Luc Janssens Studio; Diablo Valley College (former faculty)
title: Artist and Photographer; Former Chair, Foreign Language Department, Diablo Valley College
notes: Luc G. Janssens is a Belgian-born artist and educator who earned an MFA from the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Brussels, an MA from California State University, and a doctorate from the University of San Francisco. He has taught art at Merced College (Chair, Arts Division) and Diablo Valley College in Pleasant Hill, California, and maintains a studio in the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Johnston, Scott Wallace
title: Fine Artist and Portrait Painter
notes: Scott Wallace Johnston (born 1961) is a California-based fine artist and portrait painter known for 'realistic impressionism' evocative of John Singer Sargent. He attended Art Center College of Design in Pasadena at the urging of family friend Millard Sheets and earned a BFA in Illustration. He has been a professional artist for over 30 years and is a member of the Portrait Society of America and Oil Painters of America.

name: Keller, Gregory James
title: Unknown
notes: Gregory James Keller is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Krames, Lawrence Arthur
title: Founder, Krames Communications; Otolaryngologist
notes: Lawrence Arthur Krames is a San Francisco otolaryngologist who founded Krames Communications in 1974. Krames became the market leader in patient education materials, producing over 1,400 titles used by over 80% of American hospitals and more than 300,000 physicians. The company has offices in San Bruno, California and Yardley, Pennsylvania.

name: Mahany, Brian Douglas
title: Founder, Commercial Photographer, Director, and Videographer
notes: Brian Douglas Mahany is a San Francisco Bay Area commercial advertising, fashion, and food photographer. He graduated from San Francisco State University (Dean's List, Fine Art in Photography) and studied under Jack Welpott. His clients include Salesforce, Adidas, Nike, Gap, PayPal, Levi's, eBay, and Facebook.

name: Marcelli, Victor Ottavio
title: Fine Artist and Oil Painter
notes: Victor Ottavio Marcelli (born September 11, 1939) is a Santa Rosa, California-based figurative and landscape oil painter. He holds a BA from UCLA and is devoted to capturing genre figure and landscape subjects en plein air. His father was Rico Marcelli, an orchestral conductor. He is a member of the Bohemian Club.

name: Mattos, John P.
title: Award-Winning Illustrator; Owner, John Mattos Illustration
notes: John P. Mattos is an award-winning San Francisco illustrator with a 43-year career known for his crisp, colorful retro style. He graduated with a BFA from Art Center College of Design in 1975 and has won over 100 awards, including a Gold Medal from the New York Society of Illustrators. He designed the 2006 USPS Olympic Stamp and has two posters in the Library of Congress permanent collection.

name: McCauley, Adam
title: Full Professor of Illustration, California College of the Arts
notes: Adam McCauley is a San Francisco-based illustrator, artist, and Full Professor at California College of the Arts. Born in 1965, he graduated from Parsons School of Design in 1987 and has been creating editorial and children's book illustrations since 1988. He won a Society of Illustrators Gold Medal and has illustrated the Time Warp Trio and Wayside School book series.

name: Murray, Thomas J. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Thomas J. Murray Jr. is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Perez, Vincent
title: Unknown
notes: Vincent Perez is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Pyle, Charles S.
title: Unknown
notes: Charles S. Pyle is a Bohemian Club member in the Moonshiners camp. Specific biographical and employer information was not definitively identified through public records searches.

name: Stauffer, Brian
title: Illustrator and Designer; Recurring Poster Artist, San Francisco Opera
notes: Brian Stauffer (born May 20, 1966 in Prescott, AZ) is a Marin County, California-based illustrator whose work appears in The New York Times, TIME Magazine, The New Yorker, The Nation, Rolling Stone, GQ, and 300+ publications. His 2020 New Yorker cover was named 'Most Controversial Magazine Cover' by the American Society of Magazine Editors. He holds a BFA from the University of Arizona (1989) and is in his fourth season as the San Francisco Opera's poster artist.

name: Steele, Robert Gantt
title: Artist and Former Architectural Instructor, Academy of Art College, San Francisco
notes: Robert Gantt Steele trained as an architect (BArch, NC State; MArch, UC Berkeley; Fulbright Grant for study in Vienna) and later became a full-time artist living in northern California. He served as an art instructor at the Academy of Art College in San Francisco and is a signature member of the American Society of Marine Artists and member of the California Art Club.

name: Sulkowski, Joseph H.
title: Fine Artist and Painter (Poetic Realism); Sporting Art Specialist
notes: Joseph H. Sulkowski (born 1951, Pittsburgh, PA) is a realist painter specializing in dog portraits and sporting scenes with horses and foxhounds. He studied at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts and the Art Students League of New York under Frank Mason (1974-1979). His work is held in public and private collections worldwide including by Rolex and the Tennessee State Museum. He now resides in Franklin, Tennessee.
